Greensea is revolutionizing ship husbandry using autonomous robots and artificial intelligence. Through a subscription service called EverClean, Greensea robots
continuously clean ship hulls and provide regular hull surveys. Clean ship hulls result in substantially reduced operating costs, lower carbon emissions, and reduced environmental impacts while regular survey data provides the intelligence ship owners need to make on-time maintenance decisions. Using robots that are resident on ships and within ports and harbors that are supervised by remote operations specialists,
Greensea’s service is scalable worldwide at a fraction of the cost required by traditional husbandry methods.
A key deliverable of Greensea’s service is a cloud-based intelligence platform called EverClean IQ. This product allows ship owners and operators to get unprecedented access to the health and status of their hulls, enabling them to make more accurate decisions about cleaning frequency and maintenance events. Using the data collected from the hull, Greensea IQ is creating object recognition and machine learning models to enable ship owners to predict fouling levels and maintenance events to ensure that ships are running as efficiently as possible, saving fuel and reducing the global shipping industry’s greenhouse gas emission footprint.

Data science at the National Security Agency (NSA) is a multi-disciplinary field that uses elements of mathematics, statistics, computer science, and application-specific knowledge to gather, make, and communicate principled conclusions from data. Data science is present in every aspect of the mission. NSA Data Scientists tackle challenging real-world problems leveraging big data, high-performance computing, machine learning, and a breadth of other methodologies. We are looking for critical thinkers, problem solvers, and motivated individuals who are enthusiastic about data and believe that answers to hard questions lie in the yet-to-be-told story of diverse, complicated data sets. You will employ your mathematical science, computer science, and quantitative analysis skills to develop solutions to complex data problems and take full advantage of NSA's capabilities to tackle the highest priority foreign intelligence and cybersecurity challenges. Job Title: Clinical Laboratory Scientist CLS , Medical Data Scientist
Job Description:
An Oncology Research Laboratory in Silicon Valley is actively seeking a Clinical Laboratory Scientist / Medical Data Scientist to join their growing organization.

The Clinical Laboratory Scientist will report to the Laboratory Leader, and will be a member of a growing outpatient laboratory. The CA licensed CLS will be proficient in Chemistry and Hematology, with experience with blood bank as well.

The CLS generalist will be performing high complexity testing for Molecular Diagnostic techniques, including nucleic acid extraction, PCR, genotyping and next generation sequencing. The Clinical Laboratory Scientist will be responsible for participating in reagent and assay quality control and validations as needed. The CLS Generalist will be responsible for evaluating sample integrity and adhering to relevant procedures in cases of unacceptable specimens.

The busy laboratory is supporting a cutting edge genomic testing company for cancer detection and treatment. The company uses diagnostic tests to help find cancer and make informed decisions for better cancer care.

In this role, the Clinical Laboratory Scientist will focus on Data reporting and will be responsible for: evaluation scientific publications & clinical studies and integrating functional effects of genomic variants and their associated diseases. The CLS will be responsible for: updating database with finding, maintaining and updating work flows and protocols, and working with informatics and soft wear team on creating and optimizing work flows.

The Clinical Laboratory Scientist will have the opportunity to live in the San Francisco Bay Area one the nation’s most iconic cities. The region is home to a thriving economy, a booming housing market, numerous public and private universities, beautiful mountains and beaches and endless outdoor activities.

The Oncology Research Laboratory is prepared to offer a healthy work life balance, generous salary, comprehensive benefit package, stock options and a lucrative sign on bonus.

ES216 Data Scientist
NASA is more than astronauts. We are scientists, engineers, IT specialists, human resources specialists, accountants, writers, technicians, and many other kinds of people working together to break barriers to achieve the seemingly impossible.
We continue NASA’s legacy of excellence through an unprecedented array of missions—from laying the foundation to expand our human presence in deep space to developing cutting-edge technologies to studying Earth’s system. We tackle each adventure with curiosity and innovation to leave an enduring impact on the world and humanity.
Align your talents with your passion and find out why NASA has been named a best place to work” in the federal government for ten years in a row. At NASA, you’ll have an opportunity to work on unique and challenging projects that truly make an impact on humanity.
We are seeking a Data Scientist to join an exciting on-orbit NASA mission. The ICE, Cloud, and Land Elevation, Satellite (ICESat-2) Mission is a laser altimeter with a single instrument, the Advanced Topographic Laser Altimeter System (ATLAS) which was launched on September 15, 2018. ICESat-2 makes height measurements globally, over sea ice covered regions these height measurements are converted to freeboard and thickness using a suite of algorithms developed by the project. ICESat-2 is expected to create a decadal-scale time series of sea ice change extending back to the launch of ICESat in 2003 and which makes use of other satellite and airborne missions after the failure of ICESat in 2009. This task provides for the continued evaluation of data required to produce this time series from ICESat-2 and refinement of the products. Primary work will be done using Python with utilization or conversion of some heritage code written in Matlab and IDL. All code is expected to be integrated into an existing Github environment for shared work across the group of researchers working on the products. This position reports to the Prime Contractor Earth Science Group Manager for the SESDA Contract. This position is located in Greenbelt, MD.

Truth Initiative® is America’s largest non-profit public health organization dedicated to making tobacco use a thing of the past. We speak, seek and spread the truth about tobacco through education, tobacco-control research and policy studies, community activism and engagement, and innovation in tobacco dependence treatment. We are a diverse and inclusive organization.
The Innovations Center at Truth Initiative is a cross-functional team that designs, builds, evaluates, and sells leading digital solutions to help people live tobacco free. In addition to delivering cessation solutions, we conduct field-leading, federally-funded research to advance the science of tobacco cessation. The Data Scientist will support our two main products: EX Program and This is Quitting.
The EX Program® is Truth Initiative’s enterprise-level digital tobacco cessation program designed for employers, health systems, and health plans. Developed in collaboration with Mayo Clinic, it builds on the highly successful consumer platform, EX, launched in 2008 that has helped nearly 1 million tobacco users on their quitting journey. The EX Program is designed for tobacco users across the motivational continuum. It supports users through multiple, integrated modalities which include a website with an online social network, dynamically tailored text messaging fully integrated with the website, email, synchronous live chat digital coaching, and pharmacotherapy decision support and delivery. We provide value to our clients by helping their employees/members live healthier lives and demonstrating that value through a variety of reporting mechanisms.

The Auto & Home Analytics Department supports pricing of personal insurance lines of business utilizing accepted actuarial and statistical standards and methodologies. Data Scientists work closely with their Analytics Manager to support business goals. Support will be provided for those who seek the Certified Specialist in Predictive Analytics (CSPA) credential.

Company Overview: Altria has a leading portfolio of tobacco products for U.S. tobacco consumers 21+. Our tobacco companies – which have been the undisputed market leaders in the U.S. tobacco industry for decades – include some of the most enduring names in American business. In combustibles, we own Philip Morris USA, the maker of Marlboro cigarettes and John Middleton, manufacturer of Black & Mild cigars. Our smoke-free portfolio includes ownership of U.S. Smokeless Tobacco Company, the maker of Copenhagen and Skoal, and Helix Innovations, the maker of on! oral nicotine pouches. Description
The UCLA Value-Based Care Research Consortium (VBCRC) is currently seeking an an experienced Data Scientist with strong computational skills to analyze and extract clinical data. The primary focus of this position is to lead the deployment of various analyses, funded by UCLA Health, aimed at enhancing the value and quality of care, particularly for Medicare Advantage patients. Working in close collaboration with other IT teams, as well as VBCRC statisticians and faculty investigators, you will be responsible for constructing and analyzing intricate data files to support VBCRC deliverables for UCLA Health. As the senior data manager for the VBCRC, you will act as the key point of contact for all data-related communications and troubleshooting within the organization and beyond. This will involve coordinating with various VBCRC teams, including faculty members leading NIH-funded research proposals, graduate students, trainees and other stakeholders.You will also be responsible for monitoring and tracking participants in relevant VBCRC databases and dashboards, ensuring ongoing maintenance and follow-up for UCLA Health and NIH reports, as well as internal metrics reporting. Collaboration with other UCLA Health teams and dashboards will be essential to maintain consistency and data integrity for health outcomes research. In this role, you should possess the ability to develop statistical and research methodologies, conducting statistical analysis on large-scale datasets. Moreover, you should be able to demonstrate highly collaborative research skills, engaging in data exploration with clinicians and experimentalists, as well as generating data using available bioinformatics tools, as part of their daily responsibilities. You will also play a supporting role in various VBCRC projects. This role will offer the opportunity to advance bioinformatics skills while contributing to the preparation of grant proposals, manuscripts, posters, and presentations. Additionally, domain knowledge in health system quality improvement and systems engineering is a prerequisite for this position. If you are an enthusiastic and collaborative researcher with a passion for data science and healthcare, this exciting opportunity at the Department of Medicine is ideal for you. Target annual rate: $71,500.00-$154,900

The world isn’t standing still, and neither is Allstate. We’re moving quickly, looking across our businesses and brands and taking bold steps to better serve customers’ evolving needs. That’s why now is an exciting time to join our team. You’ll have opportunities to take risks, challenge the status quo and shape the future for the greater good.

You’ll do all this in an environment of excellence and the highest ethical standards – a place where values such as integrity, inclusive diversity and accountability are paramount. We empower every employee to lead, drive change and give back where they work and live. Our people are our greatest strength, and we work as one team in service of our customers and communities.

Everything we do at Allstate is driven by a shared purpose: to protect people from life’s uncertainties so they can realize their hopes and dreams. For more than 89 years we’ve thrived by staying a step ahead of whatever’s coming next – to give customers peace of mind no matter what changes they face. We acted with conviction to advocate for seat belts, air bags and graduated driving laws. We help give survivors of domestic violence a voice through financial empowerment. We’ve been an industry leader in pricing sophistication, telematics, digital photo claims and, more recently, device and identity protection.

We are the Good Hands. We don’t follow the trends. We set them. Job Summary:
Allstate Innovation helps drive Allstate’s future by identifying compelling business opportunities, developing selected opportunities into thriving businesses, and assisting Allstate businesses with meeting their innovation goals. We bring together skills in strategy, design, technology, and data science to create new products and businesses, focusing on emerging technologies, fast-growing startup market spaces, and highly impactful consumer problems. Examples of Allstate’s innovation successes in recent years include:
Exploration of AI risk assessment technologies that resulted in a new B2B big data venture, Arity – a startup with the backing of a Fortune 100 company
Exploration of emerging device (e.g. smart phone) protection space that resulted in $1.4B acquisition of SquareTrade Inc.
Exploration of digital protection space that resulted in $525M acquisition of identity protection company InfoArmor Inc.
Exploration of peer-to-peer space that resulted in a new P2P car sharing venture, Avail – a startup with the backing of a Fortune 100 company
Exploration of the future of consumer data and analytics that resulted in a series A investment in a leading Web3 startup, Inrupt, followed by joint development efforts Job Summary (cont.)
Innovation projects typically feature cross-functional teams with expertise in Business Strategy, Product, Technology, and Design. We work in a variety of different spaces, industries, and emerging technology areas. Example areas of exploration include: AI/ML (incl. generative AI), future of automotive (EVs, autonomous vehicles), climate risks, and Web3 (de-centralized consumer data).

This role will join an Innovation team that is developing algorithms and models for a new generation of insurance products. As a Senior Data Scientist, you will work on models from pricing to underwriting, utilizing geospatial, actuarial, statistical, and machine learning methodologies. You will collaborate closely with multiple organizations across Allstate Enterprise to support key business goals.

Remote work opportunities are available. Sponsorship for CAS and CSPA exams is available for any candidates with an actuarial background. Key Responsibilities:
Identify, understand and solve product/pricing problems by performing analysis that involves retrieving and analyzing both internal and external data.
Assist with analysis and implementation of changes to existing geospatial-based insurance products as well as the development of new class of personal risk products.
Perform collaborative product reviews that require analysis of trends, factors, issues, and emerging products/companies/technologies
Ability to drive for results, share and communicate findings, deal with ambiguity, wrangle small and large datasets, solve problems, and draw conclusions in a less-structured innovation environment. Key Responsibilities (cont.)
Use best practices in statistical/modeling techniques to develop and maintain rating, economic, and other models as necessary and in consideration of business goals.
Provide tools, educate and support cross functional teams in the implementation of models and other decision-making support.
Support the development/ design of new plans, programs, processes, products up to moderate complexity, with minimal direction
Assist in the development of communication strategies and materials to support new plans, programs, processes, products; solicit input from stakeholders. Relevant Experience
Bachelor’s degree required – preferably in related field of study such as actuarial science, math/applied math, statistics/applied statistics, economics, environmental science, or computer science.
Past experience with geospatial, satellite, weather, and other non-traditional to insurance datasets.
Working knowledge of insurance regulation, related business constraints, and the economics of insurance.
Experience in using statistical and machine learning modeling techniques such as linear regression, logistic regression, GLM, GAM, GBM, etc.
Master’s or PhD in a quantitative field preferred -- math/applied math, statistics/applied statistics, economics, environmental science, or computer science. Relevant Experience (cont.)
Strong technical knowledge, aptitude to learn, and curiosity.
Strong programming experience with Python preferred - R, SAS, Matlab or other scientific programming languages can be discussed
Working knowledge of using databases and SQL, Spark is a plus
Strong written and verbal communication skills including the ability to effectively collaborate with multi-disciplinary groups and all organizational levels.
High level organizational, decision making, and project management skills in order to handle multiple concurrent assignments. Notes: The preceding description is not designed to be a complete list of all duties and responsibilities. May be required to perform other related duties as assigned. Regular, predictable attendance is an essential function of this job.
Compensation offered for this role is $127,000-$165,000.00 per year and is based on experience and qualifications.

Who we are

American International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a leading global insurance organization. AIG member companies provide a wide range of property casualty insurance in approximately 70 countries and jurisdictions. These diverse offerings include products and services that help businesses and individuals protect their assets and manage risks.

We’re also committed to making a positive difference for our colleagues and in the communities where we work and live. We encourage colleagues to give back to the causes they care most about, supporting these efforts through our Volunteer Time Off and Matching Grants Programs.

Get to know the business

General Insurance is a leading provider of insurance products and services for commercial and personal insurance customers. It includes one of the world’s most far-reaching property casualty networks. General Insurance offers a broad range of products to customers through a diversified, multichannel distribution network.

About the role

The Cyber Portfolio Analytics team delivers data-driven analytics and insights to AIG’s Cyber business leaders. The team supports critical business decisions including underwriting strategy / market positioning, risk appetite and limit setting, capital allocation, portfolio risk management (including catastrophe and clash) and reinsurance / risk transfer.

The team is seeking a Cyber Insurance Data Scientist to build the next generation of AIG’s Cyber Underwriting Model and develop advanced analytics to drive business strategy. The ideal candidate will have deep technical expertise modeling insurance risk, and be highly analytical, collaborative, strategic and a forward-thinker. The candidate will partner with Cyber Security and Cyber Insurance Data Analytics Leads to build an industry-leading analytics platform to drive underwriting at transactional and portfolio levels.


Serve as the team’s lead technical expert and build analytics and predictive models to drive cyber insurance underwriting decisions. With the Head of Cyber Portfolio Analytics, translate model output into actionable, data-driven underwriting strategies; present findings and recommendations to Cyber Product Leadership to drive cyber underwriting strategy. Lead the technical design, modeling methodology and coding of AIG’s account-level, underwriting risk model; review technical details, test model accuracy and update to reflect the latest trends and threat environment. Work closely with the team’s Cyber Security Data Analytics Lead to assess the quality / lift of external data sets for use in predictive modeling.


Mid-level experience in general insurance (preferably Cyber insurance) with focus on building predictive analytics and underwriting models.
Strong expertise in the full model development process – from data wrangling, to data matching, ETL, model building, testing and deployment; highly proficient at coding in one or more languages (e.g., Python, R, SQL, Spark); adept at using data visualization techniques (e.g., R Shiny, Tableau) for exploratory data analysis.
Deep / thorough command of data science and advanced analytics methods (e.g., supervised and unsupervised machine learning) to measure cyber security risk.
Experience working cross-functionally with operations and information technology (IT) to move analytical models from development into a production environment.
Bachelor’s degree from a four-year college or university; Masters degree is strongly preferred. Technical education in a quantitative field (e.g., Actuarial Science, Analytics, Data Science, Engineering, Statistics, etc.).
Demonstrated ability to work across interdisciplinary teams to enhance risk-based decision making.
Strong communication skills (oral and written) and unique ability to translate data and technical insights into logical and compelling business recommendations.
Strong ability to identify, analyze and solve problems as well as the ability to learn rapidly, adapt quickly to change, exercise influence, and manage and prioritize multiple concurrent projects.

For positions based in New York City, the base salary range is $115,000-$170,000 and the position is eligible for a bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable incentive plan. The primary responsibilities of this role, Data Scientist, are to: Independently perform statistical analysis using a variety of modeling techniques, develop prototype solutions using scientific programming languages, design experiments for validation and testing efficacy of models, and measure impact; Understands business goals, data and methods and their limitations;

Works reproducibly by documenting, organizing, and curating data and code; Contributes skill, coaches others, and teaches other members of data science community to increase data fluency; Identifies opportunities for improvement in solving problems for models or project data; Analyzes and presents complex data in a clear manner; Continuously learns and challenges the results through new techniques and experimental approaches; Builds cross-functional relationships to collaboratively partner with the business and effectively network within the Data Science Community; Readily collaborates with subject matter experts, business stakeholders, and other Data Scientists.

Skills Required

2+ years relevant experience delivering analytics solutions to complex business problems for MS applicants

Theoretical and practical experience in deterministic optimization and algorithm development related to operations management is a requirement, including experience with commercial optimization software (ex. CPLEX or Gurobi) and simulation software (ex. AnyLogic or Simio)

Expertise in programming, statistical packages, and database languages (ex. Java, R, Python, Scala, SQL and OPL).

Ph.D. in Operations Research, Engineering, Management Science, Mathematics, or other related quantitative discipline

Greensea is revolutionizing ship husbandry using autonomous robots and artificial intelligence. Through a subscription service called EverClean, Greensea robots
continuously clean ship hulls and provide regular hull surveys. Clean ship hulls result in substantially reduced operating costs, lower carbon emissions, and reduced environmental impacts while regular survey data provides the intelligence ship owners need to make on-time maintenance decisions. Using robots that are resident on ships and within ports and harbors that are supervised by remote operations specialists,
Greensea’s service is scalable worldwide at a fraction of the cost required by traditional husbandry methods.
A key deliverable of Greensea’s service is a cloud-based intelligence platform called EverClean IQ. This product allows ship owners and operators to get unprecedented access to the health and status of their hulls, enabling them to make more accurate decisions about cleaning frequency and maintenance events. Using the data collected from the hull, Greensea IQ is creating object recognition and machine learning models to enable ship owners to predict fouling levels and maintenance events to ensure that ships are running as efficiently as possible, saving fuel and reducing the global shipping industry’s greenhouse gas emission footprint.

Greensea is revolutionizing ship husbandry using autonomous robots and artificial intelligence. Through a subscription service called EverClean, Greensea robots
continuously clean ship hulls and provide regular hull surveys. Clean ship hulls result in substantially reduced operating costs, lower carbon emissions, and reduced environmental impacts while regular survey data provides the intelligence ship owners need to make on-time maintenance decisions. Using robots that are resident on ships and within ports and harbors that are supervised by remote operations specialists,
Greensea’s service is scalable worldwide at a fraction of the cost required by traditional husbandry methods.
A key deliverable of Greensea’s service is a cloud-based intelligence platform called EverClean IQ. This product allows ship owners and operators to get unprecedented access to the health and status of their hulls, enabling them to make more accurate decisions about cleaning frequency and maintenance events. Using the data collected from the hull, Greensea IQ is creating object recognition and machine learning models to enable ship owners to predict fouling levels and maintenance events to ensure that ships are running as efficiently as possible, saving fuel and reducing the global shipping industry’s greenhouse gas emission footprint.

Greensea is revolutionizing ship husbandry using autonomous robots and artificial intelligence. Through a subscription service called EverClean, Greensea robots
continuously clean ship hulls and provide regular hull surveys. Clean ship hulls result in substantially reduced operating costs, lower carbon emissions, and reduced environmental impacts while regular survey data provides the intelligence ship owners need to make on-time maintenance decisions. Using robots that are resident on ships and within ports and harbors that are supervised by remote operations specialists,
Greensea’s service is scalable worldwide at a fraction of the cost required by traditional husbandry methods.
A key deliverable of Greensea’s service is a cloud-based intelligence platform called EverClean IQ. This product allows ship owners and operators to get unprecedented access to the health and status of their hulls, enabling them to make more accurate decisions about cleaning frequency and maintenance events. Using the data collected from the hull, Greensea IQ is creating object recognition and machine learning models to enable ship owners to predict fouling levels and maintenance events to ensure that ships are running as efficiently as possible, saving fuel and reducing the global shipping industry’s greenhouse gas emission footprint.

Senior Data Scientist
Greensea is revolutionizing ship husbandry using autonomous robots and artificial intelligence. Through a subscription service called EverClean, Greensea robots
continuously clean ship hulls and provide regular hull surveys. Clean ship hulls result in substantially reduced operating costs, lower carbon emissions, and reduced environmental impacts while regular survey data provides the intelligence ship owners need to make on-time maintenance decisions. Using robots that are resident on ships and within ports and harbors that are supervised by remote operations specialists,
Greensea’s service is scalable worldwide at a fraction of the cost required by traditional husbandry methods.
A key deliverable of Greensea’s service is a cloud-based intelligence platform called EverClean IQ. This product allows ship owners and operators to get unprecedented access to the health and status of their hulls, enabling them to make more accurate decisions about cleaning frequency and maintenance events. Using the data collected from the hull, Greensea IQ is creating object recognition and machine learning models to enable ship owners to predict fouling levels and maintenance events to ensure that ships are running as efficiently as possible, saving fuel and reducing the global shipping industry’s greenhouse gas emission footprint.

Senior Data Scientist
Greensea is revolutionizing ship husbandry using autonomous robots and artificial intelligence. Through a subscription service called EverClean, Greensea robots
continuously clean ship hulls and provide regular hull surveys. Clean ship hulls result in substantially reduced operating costs, lower carbon emissions, and reduced environmental impacts while regular survey data provides the intelligence ship owners need to make on-time maintenance decisions. Using robots that are resident on ships and within ports and harbors that are supervised by remote operations specialists,
Greensea’s service is scalable worldwide at a fraction of the cost required by traditional husbandry methods.
A key deliverable of Greensea’s service is a cloud-based intelligence platform called EverClean IQ. This product allows ship owners and operators to get unprecedented access to the health and status of their hulls, enabling them to make more accurate decisions about cleaning frequency and maintenance events. Using the data collected from the hull, Greensea IQ is creating object recognition and machine learning models to enable ship owners to predict fouling levels and maintenance events to ensure that ships are running as efficiently as possible, saving fuel and reducing the global shipping industry’s greenhouse gas emission footprint.

Senior Data Scientist
Greensea is revolutionizing ship husbandry using autonomous robots and artificial intelligence. Through a subscription service called EverClean, Greensea robots
continuously clean ship hulls and provide regular hull surveys. Clean ship hulls result in substantially reduced operating costs, lower carbon emissions, and reduced environmental impacts while regular survey data provides the intelligence ship owners need to make on-time maintenance decisions. Using robots that are resident on ships and within ports and harbors that are supervised by remote operations specialists,
Greensea’s service is scalable worldwide at a fraction of the cost required by traditional husbandry methods.
A key deliverable of Greensea’s service is a cloud-based intelligence platform called EverClean IQ. This product allows ship owners and operators to get unprecedented access to the health and status of their hulls, enabling them to make more accurate decisions about cleaning frequency and maintenance events. Using the data collected from the hull, Greensea IQ is creating object recognition and machine learning models to enable ship owners to predict fouling levels and maintenance events to ensure that ships are running as efficiently as possible, saving fuel and reducing the global shipping industry’s greenhouse gas emission footprint.

Greensea is revolutionizing ship husbandry using autonomous robots and artificial intelligence. Through a subscription service called EverClean, Greensea robots
continuously clean ship hulls and provide regular hull surveys. Using robots that are resident on ships and within ports and harbors that are supervised by remote operations specialists,
Greensea’s service is scalable worldwide at a fraction of the cost required by traditional husbandry methods.
A key deliverable of Greensea’s service is a cloud-based intelligence platform called EverClean IQ. This product allows ship owners and operators to get unprecedented access to the health and status of their hulls, enabling them to make more accurate decisions about cleaning frequency and maintenance events. Using the data collected from the hull, Greensea IQ is creating object recognition and machine learning models to enable ship owners to predict fouling levels and maintenance events to ensure that ships are running as efficiently as possible, saving fuel and reducing the global shipping industry’s greenhouse gas emission footprint.

Greensea is revolutionizing ship husbandry using autonomous robots and artificial intelligence. Through a subscription service called EverClean, Greensea robots
continuously clean ship hulls and provide regular hull surveys. Using robots that are resident on ships and within ports and harbors that are supervised by remote operations specialists,
Greensea’s service is scalable worldwide at a fraction of the cost required by traditional husbandry methods.
A key deliverable of Greensea’s service is a cloud-based intelligence platform called EverClean IQ. Using the data collected from the hull, Greensea IQ is creating object recognition and machine learning models to enable ship owners to predict fouling levels and maintenance events to ensure that ships are running as efficiently as possible, saving fuel and reducing the global shipping industry’s greenhouse gas emission footprint.

Senior Data Scientist
Greensea is revolutionizing ship husbandry using autonomous robots and artificial intelligence. Through a subscription service called EverClean, Greensea robots
continuously clean ship hulls and provide regular hull surveys. Clean ship hulls result in substantially reduced operating costs, lower carbon emissions, and reduced environmental impacts while regular survey data provides the intelligence ship owners need to make on-time maintenance decisions. Using robots that are resident on ships and within ports and harbors that are supervised by remote operations specialists,
Greensea’s service is scalable worldwide at a fraction of the cost required by traditional husbandry methods.
A key deliverable of Greensea’s service is a cloud-based intelligence platform called EverClean IQ. This product allows ship owners and operators to get unprecedented access to the health and status of their hulls, enabling them to make more accurate decisions about cleaning frequency and maintenance events. Using the data collected from the hull, Greensea IQ is creating object recognition and machine learning models to enable ship owners to predict fouling levels and maintenance events to ensure that ships are running as efficiently as possible, saving fuel and reducing the global shipping industry’s greenhouse gas emission footprint.

Communicate complex data in a simple, actionable way. Analyze and interpret large and complex data sets to assist stakeholders throughout the organization distill insights; connect disparate insights into cohesive, well-grounded recommendations. Assist stakeholders throughout the organization apply predictive modeling techniques to optimize the forecasts for planning needs. Assist stakeholders in presenting data findings and insights across most levels of leadership in a compelling way that facilitates discussion and lead to decisions. Program and write maintainable and well-documented scripts/applications for process automation; produce reusable models. Leverage programming skills to develop automated solutions that help improve business operations. Socialize the importance of data governance and ethics and ensure consistency around data quality through process improvements. Work closely with Information Technology Business Technology teams to maintain technologies, manage code within repositories, maintain appropriate documentation of solutions, perform testing to ensure accuracy of results, maintain governance processes, and continuously mature processes to align with industry best practices. Work closely with Internal Audit, Enterprise Risk Management, and cross functional business departments to ensure consistent application of practices across the company. Ability to work independently and with team members from different backgrounds to proactively evaluate data from wide variety of sources, make predictions, and identify potential business opportunities. Continuous commitment to education and awareness of industry best practice solutions for data analysis and automation. Protect business records created or used in business processes to ensure availability, confidentiality, integrity; and the retention and destruction as specified by relevant policies. Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously, ability to solve problems, memory for details, ability to prioritize, and ability to maintain concentrated mental and visual attention for sustained periods. Demonstrate a commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI). Provides reporting to the Office of Minority and Women Inclusion (OMWI), as needed, as well as partners with OMWI to implement effective policies and procedures that incorporate DEI into business activities. Knowledge and Skills: Experience: Five to Seven years of similar or related professional experience. Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Analytics, Statistics, or related field. Using robots that are resident on ships and within ports and harbors that are supervised by remote operations specialists,

Senior Data Scientist
Greensea is revolutionizing ship husbandry using autonomous robots and artificial intelligence. Through a subscription service called EverClean, Greensea robots
continuously clean ship hulls and provide regular hull surveys. Clean ship hulls result in substantially reduced operating costs, lower carbon emissions, and reduced environmental impacts while regular survey data provides the intelligence ship owners need to make on-time maintenance decisions. Using robots that are resident on ships and within ports and harbors that are supervised by remote operations specialists,
Greensea’s service is scalable worldwide at a fraction of the cost required by traditional husbandry methods.
A key deliverable of Greensea’s service is a cloud-based intelligence platform called EverClean IQ. This product allows ship owners and operators to get unprecedented access to the health and status of their hulls, enabling them to make more accurate decisions about cleaning frequency and maintenance events. Using the data collected from the hull, Greensea IQ is creating object recognition and machine learning models to enable ship owners to predict fouling levels and maintenance events to ensure that ships are running as efficiently as possible, saving fuel and reducing the global shipping industry’s greenhouse gas emission footprint.

You have experience operating in an agile, iterative, fast-paced experimentation environment, juggling multiple projects, and working across a matrixed team.
You will design and lead time-sensitive strategic research projects involving methodology development, analysis, strategic recommendations focusing on driving user growth.
You have experience in experimentation and analytics supporting user growth with a strong focus on acquisition (paid and free), retention, and churn analytics.
You are an effective communicator who presents information to key stakeholders (both technical and non technical) with the appropriate level of storytelling, visuals, data analysis, and rationale to support insights and recommendations.
You will perform deep dive analyses on web/app activity and other Yahoo data to detect opportunities and insights that drive support and learning strategies.
You are curious, exemplify a passion for your work, and take the initiative to learn new skills.


Advanced experience doing quantitative analysis using SQL/Hive, other programming languages (e.g, Python) or statistical/mathematical software (e.g, R, SAS, MATLAB)
Experience with query optimization, data ETL, and big data technologies such as Hive, Hadoop, MapReduce, Spark etc.
Machine Learning skills, including cluster analysis, neural networks, predictive modeling
Experience using Statistical techniques including correlation analysis, design of experimentation, linear and nonlinear regressions, logistic regression, sampling and resampling methods, time series, and longitudinal analysis
Proficiency in digital analytics tools such as Google or Adobe Analytics and visualization tools such as Looker or Tableau and third-party tools (e.g. Comscore, SimilarWeb, Data AI)
Knowledge of data warehouse and governance principles and methodologies

Senior Data Scientist
Greensea is revolutionizing ship husbandry using autonomous robots and artificial intelligence. Through a subscription service called EverClean, Greensea robots
continuously clean ship hulls and provide regular hull surveys. Clean ship hulls result in substantially reduced operating costs, lower carbon emissions, and reduced environmental impacts while regular survey data provides the intelligence ship owners need to make on-time maintenance decisions. Using robots that are resident on ships and within ports and harbors that are supervised by remote operations specialists,
Greensea’s service is scalable worldwide at a fraction of the cost required by traditional husbandry methods.
A key deliverable of Greensea’s service is a cloud-based intelligence platform called EverClean IQ. This product allows ship owners and operators to get unprecedented access to the health and status of their hulls, enabling them to make more accurate decisions about cleaning frequency and maintenance events. Using the data collected from the hull, Greensea IQ is creating object recognition and machine learning models to enable ship owners to predict fouling levels and maintenance events to ensure that ships are running as efficiently as possible, saving fuel and reducing the global shipping industry’s greenhouse gas emission footprint.
